chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof starting with "```coq
", ending with "Qed.```", without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```coq
simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```coq
intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Solve This Proof State:

Hypotheses:
E: R -> Prop

Goal:
{l : R | is_lb_Rbar E l} + {forall l : R, ~ is_lb_Rbar E l}

Premises:
is_lb_Rbar = fun (E : R -> Prop) (l : Rbar) => forall x : R, E x -> Rbar_le l x : (R -> Prop) -> Rbar -> Prop Argument scopes are [function_scope _]
*** [ R : Set ]
is_ub_Rbar_dec : forall E : R -> Prop, {l : R | is_ub_Rbar E l} + {forall l : R, ~ is_ub_Rbar E l}
is_lb_Rbar_opp : forall (E : R -> Prop) (l : Rbar), is_ub_Rbar E l < -> is_lb_Rbar (fun x : R => E (- x)) (Rbar_opp l)
is_ub_Rbar_opp : forall (E : R -> Prop) (l : Rbar), is_lb_Rbar E l < -> is_ub_Rbar (fun x : R => E (- x)) (Rbar_opp l)
completeness : forall E : R -> Prop, bound E -> (exists x : R, E x) -> {m : R | is_lub E m}
AlembertC3_step2 : forall (An : nat -> R) (x : R), x = 0 -> {l : R | Pser An x l}
bound = fun E : R -> Prop => exists m : R, is_upper_bound E m : (R -> Prop) -> Prop Argument scope is [function_scope]
is_lub = fun (E : R -> Prop) (m : R) => is_upper_bound E m /\ (forall b : R, is_upper_bound E b -> m <= b) : (R -> Prop) -> R -> Prop Argument scopes are [function_scope R_scope]
Alembert_C1 : forall An : nat -> R, (forall n : nat, 0 < An n) -> Un_cv (fun n : nat => Rabs (An (S n) / An n)) 0 -> {l : R | Un_cv (fun N : nat => sum_f_R0 An N) l}
Alembert_C3 : forall (An : nat -> R) (x : R), (forall n : nat, An n <> 0) -> Un_cv (fun n : nat => Rabs (An (S n) / An n)) 0 -> {l : R | Pser An x l}
is_ub_Rbar = fun (E : R -> Prop) (l : Rbar) => forall x : R, E x -> Rbar_le x l : (R -> Prop) -> Rbar -> Prop Argument scopes are [function_scope _]
AlembertC3_step1 : forall (An : nat -> R) (x : R), x <> 0 -> (forall n : nat, An n <> 0) -> Un_cv (fun n : nat => Rabs (An (S n) / An n)) 0 -> {l : R | Pser An x l}
is_upper_bound = fun (E : R -> Prop) (m : R) => forall x : R, E x -> x <= m : (R -> Prop) -> R -> Prop Argument scopes are [function_scope R_scope]
LPO : forall P : nat -> Prop, (forall n : nat, P n \/ ~ P n) -> {n : nat | P n} + {forall n : nat, ~ P n}
LPO_min : forall P : nat -> Prop, (forall n : nat, P n \/ ~ P n) -> {n : nat | P n /\ (forall i : nat, (i < n)%nat -> ~ P i)} + {forall n : nat, ~ P n}
LPO_ub_dec : forall u : nat -> R, {M : R | forall n : nat, u n <= M} + {forall M : R, exists n : nat, M < u n}
List.destruct_list : forall (A : Type) (l : list A), {x : A & {tl : list A | l = (x :: tl)%list}} + {l = Datatypes.nil}
Pser = fun (An : nat -> R) (x l : R) => infinite_sum (fun n : nat => An n * x ^ n) l : (nat -> R) -> R -> R -> Prop Argument scopes are [function_scope R_scope R_scope]
Rminus = fun r1 r2 : R => r1 + - r2 : R -> R -> R Argument scopes are [R_scope R_scope]
Un_cv_crit_lub : forall Un : nat -> R, Un_growing Un -> forall l : R, is_lub (EUn Un) l -> Un_cv Un l
LPO_bool : forall f : nat -> bool, {n : nat | f n = true} + {forall n : nat, f n = false}
Ring_polynom.PEeval : forall R : Type, R -> R -> (R -> R -> R) -> (R -> R -> R) -> (R -> R -> R) -> (R -> R) -> forall C : Type, (C -> R) -> forall Cpow : Type, (N -> Cpow) -> (R -> Cpow -> R) -> list R -> Ring_polynom.PExpr C -> R
Un_cv = fun (Un : nat -> R) (l : R) => forall eps : R, eps > 0 -> exists N : nat, forall n : nat, (n >= N)%nat -> R_dist (Un n) l < eps : (nat -> R) -> R -> Prop Argument scopes are [function_scope R_scope]
sum_f_R0 = fix sum_f_R0 (f : nat -> R) (N : nat) {struct N} : R := match N with | 0%nat => f 0%nat | S i => sum_f_R0 f i + f (S i) end : (nat -> R) -> nat -> R Argument scopes are [function_scope nat_scope]
pow = fix pow (r : R) (n : nat) {struct n} : R := match n with | 0%nat => 1 | S n0 => r * pow r n0 end : R -> nat -> R Argument scopes are [R_scope nat_scope]
LPO_notforall : forall P : nat -> Prop, (forall n : nat, P n \/ ~ P n) -> ~ (forall n : nat, ~ P n) -> exists n : nat, P n
Ring_polynom.Pphi_pow : forall R : Type, R -> R -> (R -> R -> R) -> (R -> R -> R) -> (R -> R -> R) -> (R -> R) -> forall C : Type, C -> C -> (C -> C -> bool) -> (C -> R) -> forall Cpow : Type, (N -> Cpow) -> (R -> Cpow -> R) -> (C -> option C) -> list R -> Ring_polynom.Pol C -> R
R_dist = fun x y : R => Rabs (x - y) : R -> R -> R Argument scopes are [R_scope R_scope]
Rdiv = fun r1 r2 : R => r1 * / r2 : R -> R -> R Argument scopes are [R_scope R_scope]
INR = fix INR (n : nat) : R := match n with | 0%nat => 0 | 1%nat => 1 | S (S _ as n0) => INR n0 + 1 end : nat -> R Argument scope is [nat_scope]
Rgt = fun r1 r2 : R => r2 < r1 : R -> R -> Prop Argument scopes are [R_scope R_scope]
